intro: Patrisa affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leafed spurge, is a perennial herb native to the western United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, commonly known as the spurge family, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and distinctive yellowish-green sap. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and has a low, spreading growth habit. Its flowers are small and clustered in cyathia, which are specialized inflorescences typical of the Euphorbiaceae family. Patrisa affinis is often found in open areas such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
